name: mouseWentDown()
content:
Checks if the mouse button specified was pressed.

Some interactive games use the mouse for the user to control the game. mouseWentDown() generates a single true value when the mouse button is pressed down, no matter how long the button is pressed. Use `mouseDown()` to continually check if the button is pressed.

examples.name: Black and White
examples.description: Change the background by clicking a mouse button.

palette_params.name: button
palette_params.description: The mouse button you want to check, either "leftButton" or "rightButton".

short_description: Checks if the mouse button specified was pressed.
tips: - When testing your games that use keyboard or mouse input make sure you click in the display area before you run, otherwise the Workspace will record your keyboard and mouse actions.
